channel.title: anaconda on Data Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in anaconda on Data Ramblings

item.title: Getting PyMC3 to work
item.description: In the last few days, I have been diving into Cameron Davidson-Pilon’s book Bayesian Methods for Hackers, available here. The book is an excellent, practical introduction to probabilistic programming and, more precisely, to the usage of Markov Chain Monte Carlo, purely in Python and using PyMC. The printed version of the book was published a while ago and uses the PyMC library over Python 2.7. Since then, the ecosystem has changed a bit, with the publication of PyMC3, which updates the library to Python 3.
